department.en: Department of Space Science and Engineering

goal.ch: "A presentation of the fundamentals of plasma measurement with a wide variety of applications in science, engineering, and other fields."
goal.en: "A presentation of the fundamentals of plasma measurement with a wide variety of applications in science, engineering, and other fields."

outline.ch:
"Topics include:
Ion probes: IPEI onboard ROCSAT-1 satellite, ion flux equation, retarding potential analyzer, ion traps and ion drift meters, coordinate transformation, data calibration, ion probes onboard Sounding Rocket V, plasma probe onboard Sounding Rocket VII, space plasma sensor package onboard Sounding Rocket IX, advanced ionospheric probe onboard FORMOSAT-5 satellite, etc.
For more information, please visit http://athena.ss.ncu.edu.tw/"

gradMethod.ch:
This course has no mid-term or final exams.  Two hands-on practices are requested for your grading.
1. Deriving Ti and Vr from I-V curves measured by ROCSAT-1/IPEI.
2. Deriving Te and Ti from ion probe of Sounding Rocket VII.
